main event: A civilian reported seeing a fast-moving object with lights over his home in San Bernardino, California, in 1953.
interesting points: The object was flying at a speed of 4,000-5,000 knots (around 4,600-5,800 mph) and descended towards the coast before all the lights went out.
The object was estimated to be about 100 feet in diameter and had no blinking lights or engine noise.
The witness initially described the object as flat or cigar-shaped, and then later said it had two or three white lights.
The investigating officer found the witness to be an unstable person who appeared to be a heavy drinker, and discounted the observation as unreliable.
The report mentions that a squadron of jet aircraft was moved to a different location, which may have contributed to the sighting.
